As far as prevention is concerned, the rVSV-ZEBOV vaccine was successfully used in the Democratic Republic of the Congo 2018–2019 outbreak. Surveillance, contact tracing, and quarantine are effective. A multidrug therapy is being tested. Supportive treatment is moderately effective.
74

R0 has been 1 to 1.3
75 and even 1.5.
76, 77

With regard to incidence, 29,000 cases occurred in Sierra Leone, Liberia, and Guinea during the 2014–2016 epidemic. Of these, 27% of infections were asymptomatic.
78
There were 11,500 deaths during the Sierra Leone, Liberia, and Guinea epidemic in 2014–2016.
The greatest risk of secondary attack is in nursing care and health care services in general.
Only a few imported cases occurred in Europe (primarily health professionals contaminated in Africa and treated in Europe).
